qas.question: Where did Feynman receive a job after getting his PhD?
Feyman received a letter to return to teaching from whom?
Which year did Feyman complete his PhD?
Where did Feynman spend his time during his contract at UW?
Where did Feynman get rejected for a job after getting his PhD?
Who told Feynman to never return to teaching?
Which year did Feynman lose his PhD?
Where was Feynman a senior professor of physics in 1942?

context: Following the completion of his PhD in <a2_0><b6_0>1942<b6_0/><a2_0/>, Feynman held an appointment at the <a0_0><b4_0><b7_0>University of Wisconsin–Madison<b7_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> as an assistant professor of physics. The appointment was spent on leave for his involvement in the <a3_0>Manhattan project<a3_0/>. In 1945, he received a letter from <a1_0><b5_0>Dean Mark Ingraham<b5_0/><a1_0/> of the College of Letters and Science requesting his return to UW to teach in the coming academic year. His appointment was not extended when he did not commit to return. In a talk given several years later at UW, Feynman quipped, "It's great to be back at the only university that ever had the good sense to fire me."
